title: onnx_graph_to_caffe2_net takes a model, not a graph
body_html:
🐛 Bug

I'm not sure if the naming was intentional or not. But in https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/caffe2/python/onnx/backend.py#L910

A function named onnx_graph_to_caffe2_net takes a model, instead of a specific graph.

To Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:

make call to onnx_graph_to_caffe2_net with the model.graph instead of the model

For example

init_net, predict_net = Caffe2Backend.onnx_graph_to_caffe2_net(onnx_model.graph, device="CPU")

The error you will get is
onnx.onnx_cpp2py_export.checker.ValidationError: The model does not have an ir_version set properly.

As the graph doesn't have a value ir_version, the model does.

The correct behavior would be to call
init_net, predict_net = Caffe2Backend.onnx_graph_to_caffe2_net(onnx_model, device="CPU")

Which works, but the function name may is still misleading.

body:
## 🐛 Bug

I'm not sure if the naming was intentional or not.  But in https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/caffe2/python/onnx/backend.py#L910

A function named `onnx_graph_to_caffe2_net` takes a model, instead of a specific graph.  

## To Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:

make call to `onnx_graph_to_caffe2_net` with the model.graph instead of the model

For example

`init_net, predict_net = Caffe2Backend.onnx_graph_to_caffe2_net(onnx_model.graph, device="CPU")`

The error you will get is 
`onnx.onnx_cpp2py_export.checker.ValidationError: The model does not have an ir_version set properly.`

As the graph doesn't have a value `ir_version`, the model does.

The correct behavior would be to call 
`init_net, predict_net = Caffe2Backend.onnx_graph_to_caffe2_net(onnx_model, device="CPU")`

Which works, but the function name may is still misleading.
